p: Survival in an unvaccinated patient with rabies has been reported following the experimental treatment of a teenager in the USA in 2004 [ 210]. The patient, an adolescent girl, was exposed to rabies virus through contact with a bat, and was treated through the induction of coma. Remarkably, the patient mounted a potent natural immune response to the infection, an observation not commonly noted in unvaccinated rabies patients [ 210]. The protocol has since been repeated in a number of patients with discouraging results [ 177, 178, 211, 212]. Effective therapeutic interventions still remain to be expounded [ 178].
